ğŸ“– Vol 4: Fear and Hope
And when the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) recited His saying, the Exalted: 'Indeed, the earthquake of the Hour is a tremendous thing' (Quran 22:1), he said: 'Do you know what day this is? This is a day when it will be said to Adam (upon him be peace): "Arise and send forth the contingent of the Fire from your progeny." He will say: "How many?" It will be said: "From every thousand, nine hundred and ninety-nine to the Fire and one to Paradise."' He said: So the people despaired and began to weep, and they abandoned their day from engagement and work. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) came out to them and said: 'What is the matter with you that you do not work?' They said: 'And who would engage in work after what you have informed us of this?' He said: 'How many are you among the nations? Where are the interpretations and the inheritances and the rites and Gog and Magog? Nations that none can enumerate except Allah, the Exalted. You are among all the nations like the white hair on the skin of a black ox and like the mark on the forearm of a beast.' So observe how he would drive the creation with the whips of fear and lead them with the reins of hope to Allah, the Exalted, for he drove them first with the whips of fear. Then when that took them beyond the limit of moderation to the excess of despair, he treated them with the medicine of hope and returned them to moderation and balance. The latter was not contradictory to the former, but he mentioned in the first what he saw as a cause for healing and confined himself to it. Then when they needed treatment with hope, he mentioned the completion of the matter. So upon the preacher to follow the example of the master of preachers and be gentle in employing the reports of fear and hope according to the need after observing the hidden ailments. And if he does not observe that, what he corrupts with his preaching...

Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol 3: Wonders of the Heart
This is because the Hearts (Qalb) were purified from the pasture of Satan and his power, which is the Desires (Shahawat). So whenever you hope that Satan will be repelled from you by mere Remembrance (Dhikr) as he was repelled from Umar (may Allah be pleased with him), it is impossible, and you are like one who hopes to drink medicine before protection, with the stomach occupied by coarse foods, and hopes that it will benefit him as it benefited the one who drank it after protection and emptying the stomach. The Remembrance (Dhikr) is the medicine, and God-consciousness (Taqwa) is protection, and it empties the Heart (Qalb) from Desires (Shahawat). So if the Remembrance (Dhikr) descends upon a Heart (Qalb) empty of anything other than Remembrance (Dhikr), Satan is repelled just as an ailment is repelled by the descent of medicine into an empty stomach free from foods. Allah the Exalted said: 'Indeed, in that is a reminder for whoever has a Heart (Qalb).' And He the Exalted said: 'It is decreed upon him that whoever takes him as an ally, then indeed, he misleads him and guides him to the punishment of the Blaze.' And whoever assists Satan with his action is his ally, even if he remembers Allah with his tongue. And if you say the hadith has come unrestricted that Remembrance (Dhikr) repels Satan, and you do not understand that most generalities of the Sharia are specified with conditions transmitted by the scholars of the religion, then look at yourself, for the report is not like witnessing, and contemplate that the ultimate of your Remembrance (Dhikr) and worship is the Prayer (Salah), so observe your Heart (Qalb) when you are in your Prayer (Salah) how Satan pulls it towards the markets, the accounting of the worlds, and the responses to the obstinate, and how he passes you through the valleys of the world and its perils, until you do not remember what you have forgotten of the excesses of the world except in your Prayer (Salah), and Satan does not crowd upon your Heart (Qalb) except when you pray. So the Prayer (Salah) is the test of the Hearts (Qalb), for through it their virtues and faults appear. The Prayer (Salah) is not accepted from Hearts (Qalb) filled with the Desires (Shahawat) of the world, so it is no wonder that Satan is not repelled from you; rather, perhaps he increases the whisperings upon you, just as medicine before protection perhaps increases harm upon you. So if you want deliverance from Satan, then precede protection with God-consciousness (Taqwa), then follow it with the medicine of Remembrance (Dhikr); Satan flees from you as he fled from Umar (may Allah be pleased with him).

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Tawhid and Trust
If you say: In your statement "There is no power (Hawl) nor strength (Quwwah) except with Allah" there is only the attribution of two things to Allah, so if someone says: The sky and the earth are Allah's creation, would his reward be like his reward? I say: No, because the reward is according to the degree of what is rewarded upon, and there is no equality between the two degrees, and one does not look at the greatness of the sky and the earth and the smallness of power (Hawl) and strength (Quwwah) if it is permissible to describe them as small by way of concession. For matters are not by the greatness of persons, rather every common person understands that the earth and the sky are not from the aspect of humans but they are from the creation of Allah the Exalted. As for power (Hawl) and strength (Quwwah), their matter has become obscure to the Mu'tazilites, the philosophers, and many groups who claim that they scrutinize opinion and reason until they split hair with the sharpness of their insight. This is a destructive danger and a great slippery slope in which the heedless have perished when they affirmed for themselves a matter which is polytheism (Shirk) in Divine Oneness (Tawhid) and affirmation of a creator other than Allah the Exalted. So whoever crosses this obstacle by Allah's facilitation for him, his rank has risen and his degree has become great, and he is the one who truthfully says "There is no power (Hawl) nor strength (Quwwah) except with Allah." And we have mentioned that in Divine Oneness (Tawhid) there are only two obstacles: one of them is looking at the sky and the earth and the sun and the moon and the stars and the clouds and the rain and other inanimate objects, and the second is looking at the choice of animals, and it is the greater of the two obstacles and the more dangerous, and by cutting them off is the perfection of the secret of Divine Oneness (Tawhid). Therefore, the reward of this word is great, I mean the reward of witnessing (Mushahadah) which this word translates. So when the state of reliance (Tawakkul) returns to disavowal from power (Hawl) and strength (Quwwah) and reliance (Tawakkul) on the One Truth, and it will become clear when we mention the details of the works of reliance (Tawakkul), Allah willing.

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Remembrance of Death and the Afterlife
As for the disbeliever, when he is in the approach of the Hereafter and cut off from the worldly life, harsh and severe angels descend to him with garments of fire and shirts of pitch, and they surround him. When his soul (Ruh) emerges, every angel between the heavens and the earth and every angel in the heavens curses him, and the gates of the heavens are closedâ€”there is no gate except that it dislikes his soul (Ruh) entering through it. When his soul ascends, it is cast away, and it is said: 'O Lord, Your servant so-and-soâ€”no heaven accepted him, nor earth.' Then Allah, the Exalted, says: 'Return him and show him what I have prepared for him of evil; indeed, I promised him: "From it (the earth) We created you, and into it We will return you, and from it We will bring you out another time." (Quran 20:55) And he hears the shuffling of their sandals when they turn away retreating, until it is said to him: 'O you, who is your Lord, and who is your prophet, and what is your religion?' He says: 'I do not know.' It is said: 'You did not know.' Then comes to him one with an ugly face, foul odor, and ugly garments, and says: 'Receive glad tidings of wrath from Allah and a painful, lasting punishment.' He says: 'May Allah give you evil as glad tidingsâ€”who are you?' He says: 'I am your evil deed (Amal). By Allah, you were indeed swift in disobedience to Allah and slow in obedience to Allah, so may Allah reward you with evil.' He says: 'And may Allah reward you with evil.' Then is appointed for him a blind, deaf, and dumb one with an iron clubâ€”if the two weighty ones (jinn and mankind) gathered to lift it, they would not be ableâ€”if he struck a mountain with it, it would become dust. He strikes him with it a blow, and he becomes dust. Then the soul (Ruh) returns to him, and he strikes him with it between his eyes a blow heard by those on the earths, not the two weighty ones. Then a caller calls out: 'Spread for him two slabs of fire and open for him a gate to the Fire.' So two slabs of fire are spread for him, and a gate to the Fire is opened for him.

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Remembrance of Death and the Afterlife
Allah the Exalted said: 'They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their garments therein will be silk.' And the verses about that are many, but its detail is in the reports. Indeed, Abu Hurairah reported that the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever enters Paradise enjoys without misery, his clothes do not wear out, nor does his youth perish in Paradiseâ€”what no eye has seen, no ear has heard, and has not occurred to the heart (Qalb) of a human.' And a man said: 'O Messenger of Allah, inform us about the clothes of the people of Paradiseâ€”are they created as creation or woven as weaving?' The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) remained silent, and some of the people laughed. The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Why do you laugh at an ignorant one asking a knowledgeable one?' Then the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Rather, they split from the fruit of Paradise twice.' And Abu Hurairah said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Indeed, the first group to enter Paradise, their form is like the form of the moon on the night of the full moon; they do not spit therein, nor blow their noses, nor defecate; their vessels and combs are of gold and silver, and their sweat is musk; for each of them are two wivesâ€”the marrow of her shin is seen from behind the flesh due to beauty; there is no disagreement among them nor hatred; their hearts (Qulub) are upon one heart (Qalb); they glorify Allah morning and evening (and in a narration) on each wife are seventy garments.' (Description of the clothing of the people of Paradise and their furnishings, beds, couches, and tents) Allah the Exalted said: 'They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their garments therein will be silk.' And the verses regarding that are many, and its detail is in the narrations. Indeed, Abu Hurairah reported that the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever enters Paradise enjoys bliss without misery, his clothes do not wear out, nor does his youth perish in Paradise, what no eye has seen, no ear has heard, and has not occurred to the heart (Qalb) of a human.' And a man said: 'O Messenger of Allah, inform us about the clothes of the people of Paradise, are they created or woven?' The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) remained silent, and some of the people laughed. The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Why do you laugh at an ignorant one asking a knowledgeable one?' Then the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Rather, it splits from the fruit of Paradise twice.' And Abu Hurairah said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'Indeed, the first group to enter Paradise, their form is like the form of the moon on the night of the full moon; they do not spit in it, nor blow their noses, nor defecate; their utensils and combs are of gold and silver, and their sweat is musk; each one of them has two wives, the marrow of whose shins is seen from behind the flesh due to beauty; there is no disagreement among them nor hatred; their hearts (Qulub) are upon one heart (Qalb); they glorify Allah morning and evening (and in a narration) each wife has seventy garments.' And he (peace be upon him) said regarding His statement: 'They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold': 'Indeed, upon them are crowns; the lowest pearl among them illuminates what is between the east and the west.' And he (peace be upon him) said: 'The tent is a hollow pearl, its length in the sky is sixty miles; in every corner of it, for the believer, are people who do not see them.'

Allah the Exalted said: 'And proclaim to the people the Pilgrimage (Hajj); they will come to you on foot and on every lean camel; they will come from every distant pass.' And He the Exalted said: 'That they may witness benefits for themselves.' It is said: trade during the season and reward in the Hereafter. And when some of the predecessors (Salaf) heard this, he said: May they be forgiven, by the Lord of the Kaaba. And it is said in the interpretation of His the Exalted's saying: 'I will surely sit in ambush for them on Your straight path (Sirat)' meaning the road to Mecca; Satan sits on it to prevent people from it. And he (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever performs pilgrimage to the House and does not commit obscenity or sin, he emerges from his sins like the day his mother gave birth to him.' And he (peace be upon him) also said: 'Satan has never been seen on a day smaller, more defeated, more despised, or more furious than on the day of Arafah.' And that is only because of what he sees of the descent of mercy and Allah the Glorified's overlooking of great sins, as it is said: 'Indeed among sins are sins that are not expiated except by standing at Arafah.' And Ja'far ibn Muhammad attributed it to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him). And some of the unveilers (Mukashifin) from the close ones (Muqarrabin) mentioned: That Iblis, may Allah's curse be upon him, appeared to him in the form of a person at Arafah, and he was emaciated in body, yellow in color, weeping in eye, hunched in back. He said to him: What has made your eye weep? He said: The departure of the pilgrims to Him without trade; I say they have intended Him, I fear that He will not disappoint them, so it saddens me.

And He, the Exalted, says: "Then let them complete their rites [tafathahum]." And *al-tafath* is dishevelment [al-sha'ath] and becoming dust-covered [al-ightibar], and its completion is through shaving, trimming the mustache, and cutting the nails.

Rather, the Heart (Qalb) is more deserving of being held accountable because it is the foundation. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'God-consciousness (Taqwa) is here,' and he pointed to his Heart (Qalb). And Allah the Exalted said: 'Never will Allah reach their flesh nor their blood, but He will reach the God-consciousness (Taqwa) from you.' And the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: 'Sin is what unsettles the Hearts (Qulub).' And he said: 'Righteousness (Al-Birr) is what the Heart (Qalb) finds tranquility in, even if they give you legal opinions and give you legal opinions.' So much so that we say: if the Heart (Qalb) of the jurist rules to obligate something and he is mistaken in it, he becomes rewarded for it. Rather, whoever thought he had performed ablution, then he must pray; if he prays then remembers he did not perform ablution, he has reward for his action. If he remembers then abandons it, he is punished for it. And whoever finds a woman on his bed and thinks she is his wife, he does not sin by intercourse with her, even if she is a stranger. If he thinks she is a stranger then has intercourse with her, he sins by intercourse with her, even if she is his wife. And all of that looks to the Heart (Qalb) without regard to the limbs.

Vol 4: Intention, Sincerity, and Truthfulness
The limbs are servants to the Heart (Qalb) by confirming its attributes within it, so the Heart is the intended goal and the limbs are instruments leading to the goal. Therefore, the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Indeed, in the body there is a morsel; if it is sound, the entire body becomes sound.' And he (peace and blessings be upon him) said: 'O Allah, rectify the shepherd and the flock,' intending by 'the shepherd' the Heart. And Allah the Exalted said: 'Their flesh and their blood do not reach Allah, but the God-consciousness (Taqwa) from you reaches Him.' And it is an attribute of the Heart. From this perspective, it must necessarily be that the works of the Heart, in general, are better than the movements of the limbs. Then it must be that the intention (Niyyah) is among them better, because it is an expression of the Heart's inclination toward good and its desire for it. Our purpose from works with the limbs is that the Heart returns to desiring good and confirms within it the inclination toward it, to empty it from worldly desires and to immerse it in the Remembrance (Dhikr) and reflection (Fikr). Therefore, it is necessarily better in relation to the purpose because it is established in the very intended goal.

Vol 4: Intention, Sincerity, and Truthfulness
For the intended purpose of shedding the blood of sacrifice is not the blood and the flesh, but rather the inclination of the Heart (Qalb) away from the love of the worldly life and spending it in preference for the Face of Allah the Exalted. And this attribute has been attained at the firmness of the intention (Niyyah) and the earnest striving (Himmah), even if a hindrance prevents the action. So 'Never will Allah reach their flesh nor their blood, but He will reach the God-consciousness (Taqwa) from you.' And the God-consciousness (Taqwa) here is an attribute of the Heart (Qalb). And for that reason, the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said ('Indeed, a people in Al-Madinah have shared with us in our jihad') as its mention preceded, because their hearts are in the sincerity of desiring good and spending wealth and the self (Nafs), and the desire in seeking martyrdom and raising high the word of Allah the Exalted, like the hearts of those who went out in jihad. And they only differed from them with the bodies due to hindrances specific to causes external to the Heart (Qalb), and that is not sought except for confirming these attributes. And with these meanings, you understand all the hadiths that we presented regarding the virtue of intention (Niyyah), so present them to it so that their secrets may be unveiled to you, so we will not prolong with repetition.

Vol 3: Wonders of the Heart
And due to the equivalence of the inner insight (Bassira) to the outer sight (Basar), Allah the Exalted named it with His name, so He said: 'The heart (Fu'ad) did not lie about what it saw' - He called the perception of the heart (Fu'ad) 'seeing'. Likewise, His saying the Exalted: 'And thus We showed Ibrahim the dominion of the heavens and the earth' - and He did not intend by it the apparent vision, for that is not specific to Ibrahim (peace be upon him) so that it would be presented in the context of favor. a.g: He will surely cause them to enter an entrance with which they will be pleased, and indeed, Allah is Knowing and Forbearing.
That [is so]. And whoever responds [to injustice] with the equivalent of that with which he was harmed and then is tyrannized - Allah will surely aid him. Indeed, Allah is Pardoning and Forgiving.
That is because Allah causes the night to enter the day and causes the day to enter the night and because Allah is Hearing and Seeing.
That is because Allah is the Truth, and that which they call upon other than Him is falsehood, and because Allah is the Most High, the Grand.
Do you not see that Allah has sent down rain from the sky and the earth becomes green? Indeed, Allah is Subtle and Acquainted.
To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is on the earth. And indeed, Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.

Do you not see that Allah has subjected to you whatever is on the earth and the ships which run through the sea by His command? And He restrains the sky from falling upon the earth, unless by His permission. Indeed Allah, to the people, is Kind and Merciful.

a.g: And He is the one who gave you life; then He causes you to die and then will [again] give you life. Indeed, mankind is ungrateful.

For every religion We have appointed rites which they perform. So, [O Muhammad], let the disbelievers not contend with you over the matter but invite them to your Lord. Indeed, you are upon straight guidance.
And if they dispute with you, then say, "Allah is most knowing of what you do.
Allah will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which you used to differ."
Do you not know that Allah knows what is in the heaven and earth? Indeed, that is in a Record. Indeed that, for Allah, is easy.
And they worship besides Allah that for which He has not sent down authority and that of which they have no knowledge. And there will not be for the wrongdoers any helper.

And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, you recognize in the faces of those who disbelieve disapproval. They are almost on the verge of assaulting those who recite to them Our verses. Say, "Then shall I inform you of [what is] worse than that? [It is] the Fire which Allah has promised those who disbelieve, and wretched is the destination."

O people, an example is presented, so listen to it. Indeed, those you invoke besides Allah will never create [as much as] a fly, even if they gathered together for that purpose. And if the fly should steal away from them a [tiny] thing, they could not recover it from him. Weak are the pursuer and pursued.
They have not appraised Allah with true appraisal. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might.
Allah chooses from the angels messengers and from the people. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Seeing.
He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them. And to Allah will be returned [all] matters.
O you who have believed, bow and prostrate and worship your Lord and do good - that you may succeed.

And strive for Allah with the striving due to Him. He has chosen you and has not placed upon you in the religion any difficulty. [It is] the religion of your father, Abraham. Allah named you "Muslims" before [in former scriptures] and in this [revelation] that the Messenger may be a witness over you and you may be witnesses over the people. So establish prayer and give zakah and hold fast to Allah. He is your protector; and excellent is the protector, and excellent is the helper.

Indeed, that is hardship [haraj], and there is no hardship [haraj] in the religion: *"And He has not placed upon you in the religion any hardship [haraj]"* (22:78). And this is known by the fact that when a shield [mijann] was stolen in the time of the Messenger of God, peace be upon himâ€”a hadith: "A shield was stolen in the time of the Messenger of God, peace be upon him"â€”it is agreed upon from the hadith of Ibn 'Umar that the Messenger of God, peace be upon him, cut the hand of a thief for a shield valued at three dirhams. And for one who misappropriated from the spoils [ghanima] a cloak ['aba']â€”a hadith: "One misappropriated from the spoils a cloak"â€”narrated by Al-Bukhari from the hadith of 'Abdullah ibn 'Umar, and the name of the misappropriator was Karkarah. No one refrained from purchasing shields [majan] and cloaks ['aba'] in the world [dunya]. And likewise for everything that is stolen. And thus it was known that among the people are those who trade in dirhams and dinars, and the Messenger of God, peace be upon him, and the people did not abandon dirhams and dinars completelyâ€”a hadith: "Indeed, among the people are those who trade in dirhams and dinars, and the Messenger of God, peace be upon him, and the people did not abandon dirhams completely." This is known, and the hadith of Jabir will come after it with a hadith, and it indicates that. In summary, the world [dunya] is only free from the unlawful [haram] if all creation is protected from sins, and that is impossible. And if this condition is not stipulated for the world [dunya], it is also not stipulated for a land except if it occurs among a limited group of people.
